intro: Nahuatlea obtusata, commonly known as the broad-leaved nahuatlea, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, with a soft, velvety texture. Nahuatlea obtusata produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family.
